Package api

Class DWGraph_Algo

java.lang.Object
api.DWGraph_Algo
All Implemented Interfaces:
dw_graph_algorithms
public class DWGraph_Algo
extends java.lang.Object
implements dw_graph_algorithms
this class implements "dw_graph_algorithms" and its allows to take a DWGraph and make over it some manipulations like: 0. clone(); (copy) 1. init(graph); 2. isConnected(); // strongly (all ordered pais connected) 3. double shortestPathDist(int src, int dest); 4. List shortestPath(int src, int dest); 5. Save(file); // JSON file 6. Load(file); // JSON file

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    DWGraph_Algo()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    directed_weighted_graph copy()
    this method make a deep copy of the graph at first this method create new nodes same as the nodes in the graph and after that it connect the nodes and make the same edges as the old graph
    directed_weighted_graph getGraph()
    this method return the graph we init
    void init​(directed_weighted_graph g)
    this method init the DWGraph_algo over the received DWGraph so we can run all the function of this class over the graph
    boolean isConnected()
    this method check if the graph is strongly connected means that you can go from every node in graph to every other node in this method we choose one node and run the BFS algorithm to chek if the graph is connected if the graph is connected we make a new graph that is the inverse of the graph we used for the BFS it means we create the same graph with the same nodes but we reverse all the edges now we run the BFS again and if it is connected it is strongly connected more info in the Readme
    boolean load​(java.lang.String file)
    this method load a graph from saved file all the deserializtion of the json object is made in a new class called "graph_Load"
    boolean save​(java.lang.String file)
    method to save a graph in a file in a Json form using the Gson library we made a String of the graph and save it in a file
    java.util.List<node_data> shortestPath​(int src, int dest)
    this method return a list of the shortest path between 2 nodes.
    double shortestPathDist​(int src, int dest)
    this method return the shortest path between 2 selected nodes we use the dijkstra algorithm and the Vertex class we also use a comparator that compare the path we made from the src node untill this node.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      this method check if the graph is strongly connected means that you can go from every node in graph to every other node in this method we choose one node and run the BFS algorithm to chek if the graph is connected if the graph is connected we make a new graph that is the inverse of the graph we used for the BFS it means we create the same graph with the same nodes but we reverse all the edges now we run the BFS again and if it is connected it is strongly connected more info in the Readme
      Specified by:
      isConnected in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Returns:

    • shortestPathDist

      public double shortestPathDist​(int src, int dest)
      this method return the shortest path between 2 selected nodes we use the dijkstra algorithm and the Vertex class we also use a comparator that compare the path we made from the src node untill this node. this comparator allows to maintain the node with to shortest path in to top of the priority queue
      Specified by:
      shortestPathDist in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      src - - start node
      dest - - end (target) node
      Returns:

    • shortestPath

      public java.util.List<node_data> shortestPath​(int src, int dest)
      this method return a list of the shortest path between 2 nodes. this method is similar to the method above but in here we keep for every node the node which we came from this allows you to return a list of the shortest path we used for this method an hashmap wich keep for every node the node which was before him in that way we can go to the dest node and check wich node is before him and we can go like this until we get the src node then we juast need to reverse the list and we are done
      Specified by:
      shortestPath in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      src - - start node
      dest - - end (target) node
      Returns:
